data.title: Pool volume
data.statement:
Ludovic wants to install a swimming pool in his garden.
The pool specialist offers different shapes and sizes.

Output the [[volume]] of water necessary for each choice.

testCases.title: Rectangular
testCases.testIn:
3
Small-pool Rectangular 3 2 1.2
Deep-pool Rectang 5 2 2
Dive-pool Rect 4 3 1.5

testCases.title: Validator Rectangular
testCases.testIn:
3
R1 Rec 4 3 1.5
R2 Rec 7 3 2
R3 Rec 8 4 1.5

testCases.title: Circular
testCases.testIn:
3
Small-round Circ 1.5 1.2 0
Mid-rounded Circular 1.8 1.5 0
Large-round C 2.5 1.5 0

testCases.title: Validator Circular
testCases.testIn:
3
C1 Circul 1.8 1.8 0
C2 Circ 3 2.5 0
C3 C 2 2 0

testCases.title: Mixed 1
testCases.testIn:
3
Elsa Rect 8 2.5 1.8
Barbara Cir 1.8 1.5 0
Emilie Rectangle 7 3 2

testCases.title: Mixed 2
testCases.testIn:
3
Paula C 3 1.8 0
Donna R 8 2.5 1.8
Sonia Rec 1.5 1.5 1.5

testCases.title: Long pool
testCases.testIn:
3
LongRect1 R 6 3 1.5
LongRect2 R 8 4 1.2
LongRect3 R 12 3.5 1.8

testCases.title: Validator Same Volume
testCases.testIn:
4
Dim5 R 10 5 2
Dim6 R 5 10 2
Dim7 R 2 5 10
Dim8 R 10 2 5

data.constraints:
The [[type]] of the Pool is always {{Rectangular}} or {{Circular}}, but can be abbreviated down to 1 character only ({{R}} or {{C}}),
Volume of a {{Rectangle}} : [[w]] x [[l]] x [[h]],
Volume of a {{Cylinder}} : {{π}} x ([[radius]])² x [[d]],
The constant {{π}} (named {{pi}}) can be rounded to {{3.14159}}, or 3.1416 if necessary.
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read name:word(15) type:word(15) A:float B:float C:float
loop n write PoolName Volume

STATEMENT
Output the PoolNames and corresponding Volumes, in order of increasing Volume.

INPUT
n: n is the number of choices
name: name is the PoolName
type: type is the Type of Pool : either Rectangular or Circular
A: If Rectangular : A, B and C are Width, Lenght and Height of the Pool
B: If Circular : A and B are the radius and Height of the Pool
C: If Circular : C = 0

OUTPUT
Output the PoolNames and corresponding Volumes (rounded to 2 decimals),
 in order of increasing water Volume.
data.inputDescription:
<<Line1 :>> Number [[n]] of choices,

<<Next [[n]] Lines :>> [[name]] of the Pool, [[type]] of the Pool, and 3 floats [[A]], [[B]] and [[C]] space-separated.

if [[type]] is {{R}}ectangular : [[A]], [[B]] and [[C]] are respectively [[w]], [[l]] and [[h]] of the Pool,
if [[type]] is {{C}}ircular : [[A]] and [[B]] are respectively the radius [[r]] and depth [[d]] of the Pool, [[C]] is ignored.
data.outputDescription: << [[n]] lines :>> the [[name]] and the [[volume]] corresponding to each of the [[n]] possible choices, in order of increasing water [[volume]] (rounded 2 digits max).
